name: 100 Cities Project: Fighting Loneliness | Dinner with Strangers (68)
location: Arbor, H Queen's #25/F Hong Kong, HKI
about: Hey, Hong Kong!When was the last time you did something completely spontaneous? Our series groups together complete strangers for a fun day out. That's right, you sign up, and we book the restaurant. We know life can get busy. Don't forget to spend time making new friends! Don't do city life alone and build your community with us. This project is to host dinners in 100 major cities to combat loneliness while supporting locally owned businesses. We are dedicating 25% of sales towards charity or GoFundMe pages at the end of each month.How does it work?-After you register, you'll be emailed an introduction message including a quick questionnaire regarding age, dietary restrictions, hobbies, and interests that we use to select restaurants for the night's group.-At the end of the month, we'll share sales reports with attendees and detail how we are utilizing 25% of sales towards social good.*Your registration does not include your individual food and drink purchases.*These outings are intended to help people make friends. These are not singles gatherings.Our vision is simple: we take the no gimmicks approach to networking. No need for yet another app to take up space on your phone - just four walls and a roof and good food for people to connect :) We coordinate with you directly, human-to-human.If you have any more questions, please contact ermantourageimpact@gmail.com!Brought to you by event series Ermantourage.You can also take a look at our main event calendar via Posh for coffee meets, evening hangouts, and more!

name: Good Grief
location: The Hive Wan Chai, 23 Luard Road 9/F Wan Chai, HKI
about: What it isGood Grief is a free peer support group for anyone who has experienced/to talk about grief and bereavement. Our peer support groups are free to join.Good Grief provides a supportive, judgment-free space where people can share their experiences of loss, connect with others who understand, and find comfort as a collective. Led by trained hosts, our sessions offer a supportive environment to navigate grief together.What happensA peer support group is where people come together to share personal stories, listen and support one another with kindness. You will be welcomed by two hosts who are trained TNN volunteers with lived experience in the topic of the group. It is normal to feel nervous, and sharing can be a big decision. Remember you are deserving of care and support. You are welcome to join us and just listen.Our hosts will welcome you and provide an introduction, then we will ask you to introduce yourself and your reason for joining us. From then on there is no pressure to speak. Our hosts will facilitate conversation.A peer support group is a supportive space where people can:Share stories and how our experiences are currently impacting our livesTalk about our feelings and emotionsShare and discuss coping strategiesGroup guidelinesWe have some basic guidance that we ask everyone to adhere to, to ensure this remains an inclusive space for everyone:Our groups are confidential; please don’t discuss specifics outside of the space, and no recording of the group is permitted.This is a space for you to share your experience honestly and without judgment or expectation.There is never any pressure to speak or share if you do not wish to. You are welcome to join and just listen.Please give the speaker our full attention: the person sharing should be the only one speaking.If the co-host or I step in to redirect the conversation either due to the interest of time or going off topic, we are not cutting you off.Please be kind to yourself and each other.Please listen with compassion.We do not compare here, everyone’s experience is valid and to be respected.Please noteAs a peer support group, this group is for peers to share their personal struggles and support one another. Attendees are welcome to come and listen but it is not a space to observe. You should attend to engage in peer support. It is not a space for students to contribute to their studies, for clinicians to observe, or for the press unless written agreement from the charity has been obtained.Who are The New Normal Charity?We are a Hong Kong S88 registered charity. The New Normal Hong Kong have been hosting our free peer support groups in Hong Kong since 2022. Our groups are facilitated by volunteers. While our hosts are trained to facilitate, we are not mental health professionals in this space. We do not give advice, we provide space for all of you to share, connect and support. Nobody should ever feel alone, and there is always somebody who can relate to your story.www.thenewnormalcharityhk.orgIf you are in crisis and don’t feel like you can keep yourself safe there are immediate services available.危機求助熱線如果你覺得你不能保證自己的安全Samaritans 2341 7227 (until 10pm) 2389 2222 (24/7)Caritas 18288SPS Hotline 23820000AddressThe Hive Wan Chai9/F, The Phoenix, 23 Luard Rd, Wan Chai, Hong KongHow to get there3 minute walk from Wan Chai Station:From Exit C, turn left and walk along Lockhart Road. Turn right when you reach Luard Road. Walk up Luard Road – The Phoenix will be on your left.

name: Dance Dance Involution Benefit Party
location: Zerve, 9/F, Zing! 38 Yiu Wa Street Causeway Bay, HKI
about: DANCE DANCE INVOLUTION BENEFIT PARTY - a Deliberate Collision ProductionSupport Gen Z HK female artists heading to Edinburgh Fringe!Why lie flat when you can DANCE, debate, and drink on a fine Saturday night (26 JULY)We’re hustling to bring our show Dance Dance Involution to Edinburgh Fringe— and we need YOUR help to get there!🎤 LINE-UP:✔️ A special preview of the juicy final act of our show!✔️ Live dancing and singing (yes, crowd duets!)✔️ Impressive 2x-speed debates within the show (chaotic = iconic)✔️ TikTok live-scrolling to LIVE PERFORMANCE (your feed, IRL)✔️ Wild auctions + nostalgic pizza & cake sales (come hungry!)🎟️ TICKETS:🔸 Early Bird: $280 (or $180 for students!)🔸 Door Price: $320 ($200 students)🍻 YOUR TICKET INCLUDES:2 drinks + endless vibes + a sneak exclusive preview of our show! (PS: Skip dinner—we’ve got pizza & cake!)

name: 2025「與農共耘」義工計劃
location: 香港有機生活發展基金, 八鄉河背村66號 元朗, NT
about: 2025「與農共耘」義工計劃透過共耕共作的農務體驗，讓都市人走進鄉村農田，由觸摸土地開始，重新解放身體五感，感受有機種植對自然的重要、學習本地傳統農藝的智慧、細味鄉村文化的醇厚，讓農村與城市重新連繫，建立互助互信的社區關係。計劃將會以「SEED河背農圃」作為共作基地，並每月第一個星期日舉辦義工活動日。參加者將會由經驗豐富的農夫帶領，學習與自然共存的生產方式，體驗一年四季的農田變化，品嚐春夏秋冬的在地味道。歡迎任何人士參與，走進農田，回歸樸實，與農夫同行走過每一個歷程，收獲非一般的體驗！請留意：十二歲或以下人士必須由家長或監護人陪同參與。由於部分農務工作需具備種植經驗或足夠的體力，主辦單位將會按照個別人士的經驗、能力及身體情況分配合適的工作，並會安排休息時間。活動詳情：日期：1月至12月，每月第一個星期日**時間：上午9:00 至下午1:00語言：粵語 （按需要可提供簡單英語翻譯）費用：每位港幣50元，包括共作「時令農產茶點」內容：協助河背農圃的日常農務學習基本有機種植技巧了解本地農作物參與食農環節，合作準備時令農產茶點備註：義工需自備個人用品：飲用水及水樽。農用水鞋或波鞋 （田地較多沙石，請勿穿拖鞋或涼鞋）。個人防曬用品，包括：防曬帽、防曬手套、穿輕便防曬服裝。**因天氣情況或個別事件，活動日有機會取消或改期，敬請密切留意本會的最新通知。

name: Hong Kong Dolphin Watch Tour
dateTime: Hong Thai Expo and Business Centre
location: The Kowloon Hotel, Middle Road Tsim Sha Tsui, KOW
about: Embark on a captivating dolphin watching journey with the Hong Kong DolphinWatch team as we set sail in search of the enchanting “pinkies” – the native Chinese pink dolphins that grace the waters of Hong Kong. Our adventure unfolds in North Lantau, where the merging currents of the South China Sea and Pearl River create the perfect feeding grounds for the small pod that remains.HighlightsReturn transfers from Tsim Sha Tsui to Tung Chung to board the newDolphinWatch boatLearn all you need to know about the unique pink dolphin from specialist guidesThree to four hours at sea for dolphin watchingInclusionsSpecialist pink dolphin expert guideAccredited local guideCoach transfersDolphinWatch ticketsInsuranceExclusionsFood and drinksTour DetailsDeparture date: 8:50am from Tsim Sha Tsui outside Kowloon Hotel (behind Peninsula Hotel); or 9:30am from Tung Chung New Development PierTour fee per person: Adult HK$600, child $400 (4-11 years)

name: Dog shelter: New volunteer training  with "Sai Kung Stray Friends"
location: 151 Tai Lam Wu Rd, 151 Tai Lam Wu Road Sai Kung, NT
about: Sai Kung Stray Friends Foundation founded by Ms. Narelle Pamuk is a volunteer run charity that rescues and cares for stray dogs in Hong Kong.Our dog shelter in Sai Kung takes care of over 200 dogs.Our dedicated team of volunteers support our Kennel Manager Ms. Kathy to manage and operate the dog shelter for all 365 days of the year. The daily work routine includes walking the dogs, cleaning, cooking food, feeding the dogs, driving the dogs to the vets, deliver food & medical care to stray dogs around Sai Kung and Lok Ma Chau. Our team of volunteers come from diverse background and share a common love for dogs.This program is for animal lovers who are interested to join as a member of our team of volunteers.During the training, you will get to do the various house keeping tasks (cleaning, cooking, washing etc) to be done at shelter. Get to know the various dogs, understand differences of every dogs to take care when leashing/walking. And also get to know the dogs that new volunteers should not disturb. By the end of the day, you will have experienced the daily work routine of a regular volunteer at the shelter. You can then decide if you are able to commit to join our team and volunteer regularly every week.The training will be led by our senior volunteers. ⁠⁠Each group will consist of 6-10 people. The training will be bi-lingual in Cantonese and English.⁠note1. Participants need to be above 16 yo of age commited to animal welfare.note2. Participants are required to sign the waiver of liability agreementDOWNLOAD Waiver of liability agreementEmail the signed agreement to volunteersaikungstrayfriendshk@gmail.com. In email subject, mention {your name} and date of training registered for.note3. The organiser reserves the right to cancel the event for a specific date . In such case, you will be notified by email /whatsapp the reason for cancellation and provided a list of alternate dates that you can select based on your convenience.

name: Healing Hearts
location: The Hive Wan Chai, 23 Luard Road 9/F Wan Chai, HKI
